author: sky.cactus
content: You don't get to pick the number.

author: clearlight1596
content: could you explain what you mean

author: sky.cactus
content: EIP numbers are assigned at the time the EIP is created.  Essentially, the number is random (or should be treated as such).

author: sky.cactus
content: If you create an EIP for a new standard, it may be EIP-4573 or something.  If it is an ERC (a subset of EIPs) then it will also be ERC-4573.

author: sky.cactus
content: If it is related to EIP authoring, then https://discord.gg/Rdcg5zGh is a better place to ask.
